author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: I got some Lupin games for Saturn.
body:
I got two Sega Saturn video games on Friday. Wanna
know what they are?

Lupin III: The Sage of Pyramid
(Rupan Sansei: Piramiddo no Kenja)

The Lupin III Chronicles
(T-8805G version)

I have played both. The Lupin III Chronicles is not a
video game, but is (as the box says in katakana) a
"data-tainment" title. It has various bits and clips
from series 1 and 2 and the 1st two anime films, as
well as a trivia game and a collection of scenes that
have special music in the background. It also has
still shots of important objects and characters from
the different episodes. There seem to be 3 versions:
T-8804G
T-8805G
T-8806G
I don't know how they are different, but they are
somehow.

The "Lupin III: Sage of the Pyramid" game is sort of
like a weird-control Tomb Raider, with a weird
polygonal Lupin as your main character. There are a
few clips at the beginning that tell a bit of a story,
but the character design seems a bit off. This is
especially true when Lupin is hitting on some
mysterious girl inside the pyramid, his face looks all
wrong.

Anyway, my thanks to Justin Buck from the Lupin ML, he
looked around overseas and shipped them to me. What a
nice guy (of course, I had to pay him).
